result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonte Timothy Allen

defendant.name: Allen, Devonte Timothy
defendant.address: 5233 North Lovers Lane Road, #201, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt: Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Devonte Timothy Allen.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.

AS TO  AMENDED COUNT 3: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 1, COUNT 2  and AMENDED COUNT 4: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1, COUNT 2  and AMENDED COUNT 4 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Defense requested Presentence Investigation. Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

-received, filed, and distributed. Defense and Defendant received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1 and COUNT 2: Remains as originally charged.

AS TO NEW COUNT 3: On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 3 AMENDED TO FIRST DEGREE RECKLESS INJURY - PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, HABITUAL CRIMINALITY REPEATER, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 940.23(1)(a), 939.50(3)(d), 939.05, 939.62(1)(c), 939.63(1)(b), a Class D. 

AS TO NEW COUNT 4: On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 4 AMENDED TO THEFT - MOVABLE PROPERTY (SPECIAL FACTS) - PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, HABITUAL CRIMINALITY REPEATER, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(d), 939.50(3)(h), 939.05, 939.62(1)(b), 939.63(1)(b), a Class H.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in Court for Devonte Timothy Allen.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Defense requested a plea date. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court VACATED Jury Trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:15 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Devonte Timothy Allen.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received a new offer from the State and requested an adjournment. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant also has Case 22CF497 in Branch 45. Discussion placed on the record. Defense recently received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defender requested time to review case with Defendant. State advised the Court of Defendant's federal indictment. Court ordered Defense and State to meet 48 hours in advance of the next Court date. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 16CF683 & 16CF2215. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: M. Finkley - MPD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017581,
Payable Number: 987042,
Receipt Number: 22RP007174,
Amount: $20.00
Case charged by ADA Joshua Mathy. Per Chief Judge Directive 21-13, this case is transferred to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Oral No Contact Order with X.D.H.

Defendant Devonte Timothy Allen in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arrest warrant declined. Court proceeds with initial appearance.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
